result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from A.T.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: No contact with the victim A.T (person, property, residence or family). It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
NG plea entered.

9:41 AM Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Andre D Taylor in court, in custody.  Attorney Jeremy Michael Samuels in court for Andre D Taylor. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim is present in the hearing room. 
State calls Officer D. Wells DSAT
Direct by the State.
Defense on cross.
State moves for bind over.
Defense objects.
BTC: Probable cause found, bound over on all charges. 

Defense moves to address bond. Defendant is on a DOC hold, would like to become a jail trustee, asking for a lower bond around $100 cash.
State would be objecting to the modification to a $100 bond, also concerned for the safety of the victim as they have not been to the women's resource center.
Defense gives argument.
BTC: Motion to modify bond is granted to a $1000 cash bond, same conditions apply.
Status conference scheduled for May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Status conference on May 17, 2022 at 09:00 am.

9:05 AM Prosecuting attorney Jennifer Tanck-Adams appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Andre D Taylor appeared in court, in custody. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. Victim appears in the court room. 
Defense requests a contested hearing. Requests to address bond, reducing it to lower cash.
State objects to bond modification with argument. 
Victim A.T speakers requesting the bond be lowered. 
BTC: Motion to modify bond denied. Defendant is also on a hold. 
BTC: Finding of good cause of waive time limits, Preliminary hearing to be set.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
